result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony James Medora was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to any other sentence

Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 2 years initial confinement in this case.

miscConds.notes:
$1,500.00 payable to State Farm, and $1,251.00 to Sarah L. JOINT AND SEVERAL with Kelly Froemke #15CF502.
- Restitution owed to Barbara M. will be determined at hearing on 09-09-15 at 8:30am.
**10/5/2015  amount of $12,192.00.   To be paid to Barbara M. by the end of probation.  Joint and several with Kelly Froemke 15CF502.
If revoked, out of up to 25% prison funds.  Any balance as condition of ES.  if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Provide a DNA sample if not already done. Pay all costs, surcharges and restitution, including the mandatory DNA surcharge by the end of probation. If revoked, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balances as a condition of ES. If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION TO BE DETERMINED BY THE DOC's, BUT TO INCLUDE:
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens. No positive results.
- No illegal drugs.
- No controlled substances without valid prescription.
- No Contact with drug community.
- No Contact with the victims: Barbara M., Sarah L., and Co-acor Kelly Froemke.
- Seek/maintain full-time employment.
- Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

The  Court ordered the privileges previously granted  are cancelled, and the defendant is sentenced to ordinary confinement for the balance of the term heretofore imposed.

FORTHWITH; The first 3 months, Huber privileges for work, school and treatment and the defendant is eligible for electronic monitoring. The last 5 months, Huber privileges for work, school and treatment and is eligible for the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.

amended per restitution ordered
Per restitution ordered

Defendant Anthony James Medora in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs.  Defendant Anthony James Medora in custody.  James C. Griffin for Tyrone St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for restitution hearing.  Parties stipulated to restitution in the amount of $12,192.00, to be paid to Barbara M. by the end of probation.  If revoked, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.  Restitution is ordered joint and several with Kelly Froemke 15CF502.
filed.

Defendant Anthony James Medora in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for restitution hearing.   Court is in trial.   Case adjourned for restitution hearing, Branch 26.  Restitution hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony James Medora in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 26.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  Additional statement by Barbara M.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 6 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 3 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years. 

Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*
As a condition of probation, Court ordered defendant to serve 8 months in the House of Correction.  FORTHWITH.  
-The first 3 months, huber privileges for work, school and treatment and the defendant is eligible for electronic monitoring.  
-The last 5 months, huber privileges for work, school and treatment.  The defendant is eligible for the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victims: Barbara M., Sarah L. and Co-actor Kelly Froemke.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is ordered in the amounts of $1,500.00 to be paid to State Farm, $1,251.00 to be paid to Sarah L. Joint and several with Kelly Froemke 15CF502.  Restitution owed to Barbara M. will be determined at a restitution hearing.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and restitution, including the mandatory DNA surcharge by the end of probation.  If revoked, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant advised that she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.

- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 2 years initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Restitution hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Telephone call from attorney Sachs to reschedule sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 1:30 pm.  New sentencing hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 8:30 am.
received and filed on behalf of the defendant.

Defendant Anthony James Medora in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs.  James C. Griffin and Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 1 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

COUNT 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Restitution will be determined at sentencing.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony James Medora in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony James Medora in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs.  James C. Griffin appeared for Tyrone Martin St. Junior for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is being evaluated for Drug Treatment Court.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Anthony James Medora in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anthony James Medora in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs.  Ron Dague for Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with with the co-defendant Kelly M. Froemke; BM-M; and SL or their residence.

Defendant Anthony James Medora in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/4/15 @ 1:30pm
